body.p: The following functions, which are all provided by ebuild.sh and the standard library, handle various install-related tasks. ${D} is automatically handled for all of these functions.

The do* functions, when given multiple arguments, will work upon multiple targets. The new* functions take exactly two arguments (except as noted) the first is the source name, the second the name to use when installing.

tr.ti: Change install location for dobin, newbin, dosbin, newsbin, dolib, dolib.a, newlib.a, dolib.so, newlib.so
Change install location for doins, newins
Change install location for doexe, newexe
Change install location for dodoc, newdoc
Specify arguments passed to install (eg -s, -m644)
Specify arguments passed to install for directories
Specify arguments passed to install for executables
Specify arguments passed to install for libraries
Install a binary into /usr/bin, set the file mode to 0755 and set the ownership to superuser or its equivalent on the system or installation at hand.
Install an /etc/conf.d file
Install a directory
Install a documentation file into /usr/share/doc/${PF}. For EAPI 4 and above, the -r option allows directories to be installed recursively.
Installs the files and directories specified by the DOCS and HTML_DOCS variables into /usr/share/doc/${PF} recursively using dodoc -r. Note: Approved in EAPI 6.
Install an /etc/env.d file
Install an executable into the location provided by exeinto, by default with mode 0755 or with the install options set by exeopts
Install a header file into /usr/include. The -r option allows directories to be installed recursively.
Installs HTML document files into /usr/share/doc/${PF}/html The -r option allows directories to be installed recursively. Note: Deprecated in EAPI 6, switch to einstalldocs instead
Install a GNU Info document
Install an /etc/init.d file
Install a miscellaneous file. The -r option allows directories to be installed recursively.
Install a library file
Install a library (.a) file
Install a library (shared object) file
Install a man page
Install a Gettext .mo file
Install an sbin/ file

Create a symlink to the target specified as the first parameter, at the path specified by the second parameter. Note that the target is interpreted verbatim; it needs to either specify a relative path or an absolute path including ${EPREFIX}.
Call chown on the specified files in ${D}
Call chmod on the specified files in ${D}
Create a directory which will be preserved by the package manager (This is typically accomplished by inserting an empty .keep_${CATEGORY}_${PN}-${SLOT%/*} file in the directory)
Install a binary using the second argument as the name
Install an /etc/conf.d entry using the second argument as the name
Install a documentation file using the second argument as the name
Install an /etc/env.d file using the second argument as the name
Install an executable file using the second argument as the name
Install a header file using the second argument as the name
Install an /etc/init.d file using the second argument as the name
Install a miscellaneous file using the second argument as the name
Install a .a library file using the second argument as the name
Install a .so library file using the second argument as the name
Install a manual page using the second argument as the name
Install an sbin file using the second argument as the name
